sen.j: 物集 高見（もずめ たかみ、 弘化4年5月28日 (旧暦)（1847年7月10日） - 昭和3年（1928年）6月23日）は豊後国（大分県）出身の国学者。
sen.e: Takami MOZUME (July 10, 1847-June 23, 1928) was a scholar of Japanese classical literature from Bungo Province.
Takami MOZUME (July 10, 1847 - June 23, 1928) was a scholar of Japanese classical literature from Bungo Province.
sen.cmt: スペース補足しました。
sen.e: Takami MOZUME (July 10, 1847 - June 23, 1928) was a scholar of Japanese classical literature from Bungo Province.

sen.j: 経歴
sen.e: Career
Career
Career

sen.j: 父は国学者物集高世。
sen.e: His father was Takayo MOZUME, a scholar of Japanese classical literature.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: His father was Takayo MOZUME, a scholar of Japanese classical literature.
His father was Takayo MOZUME, a scholar of Japanese classical literature.

sen.j: 高見はその二男三女の長男として豊後国（現、大分県）速見郡杵築北新町に生まれる。
sen.e: Takami was the first son among two sons and three daughters of Takayo, and was born in Kizukikitashinmachi Town, Hayami County of Bungo Province (present Oita Prefecture).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Takami was the first son among two sons and three daughters of Takayo, and was born in Kizukikitashin-machi Town, Hayami County of Bungo Province (present Oita Prefecture).
sen.cmt: Kizukikitashin-machi Townハイフン補足しました。
sen.e: Takami was the first son among two sons and three daughters of Takayo, and was born in Kizukikitashin-machi Town, Hayami County of Bungo Province (present Oita Prefecture).

sen.j: 幼名素太郎、後に善五郎と改める。
sen.e: His childhood name was Sutaro, later renamed to Zengoro.
His childhood name was Sutaro, later renamed to Zengoro.
His childhood name was Sutaro, later renamed to Zengoro.

sen.j: 鶯谷・菫園または埋書居士と号する。
sen.e: His pen names were Uguisudani, Sumire en, or 埋書居士.
sen.cmt: 「菫園」「埋書居士」は読み方不明
sen.e: His pen names were Uguisudani, Sumireen, or Maisho Koji.
sen.cmt: スペース削除しました。「菫園」「埋書居士」は読み方不明
sen.e: His pen names were Uguisudani, Sumireen, or Maisho Koji.

sen.j: 少年時代、故郷で漢学と国学を修める。
sen.e: As a youngster, he studied Sinology and Japanese literature and culture in his hometown.
As a youngster, he studied Sinology and Japanese literature and culture in his hometown.
As a youngster, he studied Sinology and Japanese literature and culture in his hometown.

sen.j: 慶応元年（1866年）、長崎に出て蘭学を修める。
sen.e: In 1866, he went to Nagasaki to study Western learning.
In 1866, he went to Nagasaki to study Western learning.
In 1866, he went to Nagasaki to study Western learning.

sen.j: 慶応2年（1867年）、20歳の折に京都に出て、玉松操や六人部是香に師事して国書を修める。
sen.e: In 1867 at the age of 20, he went to Kyoto and studied sovereign's message under Misao TAMAMATSU and Yoshika MUTOBE.
In 1867 at the age of 20, he went to Kyoto and studied sovereign's message under Misao TAMAMATSU and Yoshika MUTOBE.
In 1867 at the age of 20, he went to Kyoto and studied sovereign's message under Misao TAMAMATSU and Yoshika MUTOBE.

sen.j: 明治2年（1869年）に上京。
sen.e: He went to Tokyo in 1869.
He went to Tokyo in 1869.
He went to Tokyo in 1869.

sen.j: 明治3年（1870年）5月、平田銕胤（明治13年没、年82）門に入り国学を修める。
sen.e: In May 1870, he became a disciple of Kanetane HIRATA (died in 1880 at the age of 82) and studied Japanese literature and culture.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In May 1870, he became a disciple of Kanetane HIRATA (died in 1880 at the age of 82) and studied Japanese literature and culture.
In May 1870, he became a disciple of Kanetane HIRATA (died in 1880 at the age of 82) and studied Japanese literature and culture.

sen.j: また神祇官職員の東條琴臺（明治11年没、年84）に師事して漢学を修める。
sen.e: Also studied Sinology under Kindai TOJO (died in 1878 at the age of 84), an official of Jingikan (Department of Divinities).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Also studied Sinology under Kindai TOJO (died in 1878 at the age of 84), an official of Jingikan (Department of Divinities).
Also studied Sinology under Kindai TOJO (died in 1878 at the age of 84), an official of Jingikan (Department of Divinities).

sen.j: 同年から神祇官の宣教史生の職を得た。
sen.e: He gained a job as a Senkyoshisei (official worker for Senskyoshi) for Jingikan from the same year.
He gained a job as a Senkyoshisei (official worker for Senskyoshi) for Jingikan from the same year.
He gained a job as a Senkyoshisei (official worker for Senskyoshi) for Jingikan from the same year.

sen.j: 明治4年（1871年）24歳からは洋学も修める。
sen.e: Since 1871 at the age of 24, he started to study Western studies.
Since 1871 at the age of 24, he started to study Western studies.
Since 1871 at the age of 24, he started to study Western studies.

sen.j: 明治5年（1872年）から教部省に出仕する（中録十等）。
sen.e: In 1872, he began to serve Kyobusho (Ministry of Religion) (churoku jutto).
In 1872, he began to serve Kyobusho (Ministry of Religion) (churoku jutto).
In 1872, he began to serve Kyobusho (Ministry of Religion) (churoku jutto).

sen.j: 職務のかたわら辞書編纂を企画した。
sen.e: He planned to edit a dictionary while working.
He planned to edit a dictionary while working.
He planned to edit a dictionary while working.

sen.j: また「本邦語源考」「事物名義考」の研究発表もしている。
sen.e: Also, he published his research paper such as 'Honpogogenko' and 'Jibutsumeigiko.'
sen.cmt: 「本邦語源考」「事物名義考」は読み方不明
sen.e: Also, he published his research paper such as 'Honpogogenko' and 'Jibutsumeigiko.'
Also, he published his research paper such as 'Honpogogenko' and 'Jibutsumeigiko.'

sen.j: 高見の言語に対する興味はこの頃からあった。
sen.e: He came to be interested in languages around that time.
He came to be interested in languages around that time.
He came to be interested in languages around that time.

sen.j: 明治7年(1874年)27歳の時、杵築在の岩田なつ子と結婚する。
sen.e: IN 1874 at the age of 27, he married Natsuko IWATA who lived in Kitsuki.
In 1874 at the age of 27, he married Natsuko IWATA who lived in Kitsuki.
In 1874 at the age of 27, he married Natsuko IWATA who lived in Kitsuki.

sen.j: 国文法研究には英文法が必要と考え、明治8年（1875年）からは近藤真琴のもとで英語を学ぶ。
sen.e: He thought learning English grammar was necessary for the study of Japanese grammar, and started to study English under Makoto KONDO since 1875.
He thought learning English grammar was necessary for the study of Japanese grammar, and started to study English under Makoto KONDO since 1875.
He thought learning English grammar was necessary for the study of Japanese grammar, and started to study English under Makoto KONDO since 1875.

sen.j: 教部省が廃止されたので、内務省に移る。
sen.e: Since Kyobusho was abolished, he was transferred to Ministry of Interior.
Since Kyobusho was abolished, he was transferred to Ministry of Interior.
Since Kyobusho was abolished, he was transferred to Ministry of Interior.

sen.j: 明治12年（1879年）、高見33歳の折に内務省より月山神社宮司兼羽黒山神社・湯殿山神社宮司に任ぜられる。
sen.e: In 1879 at the age of 33, Takami was appointed by the Ministry of Interior as a Guji (chief of those who serves shrine, controls festivals and general affairs) of Gassan Jinja Shrine and a Guji of Haguroyama-jinja Shrine and Yudonosan-jinja Shrine.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In 1879 at the age of 33, Takami was appointed by the Ministry of Interior as a Guji (chief of those who serves shrine, controls festivals and general affairs) of Gassan-jinja Shrine and a Guji of Haguroyama-jinja Shrine and Yudonosan-jinja Shrine.

In 1879 at the age of 33, Takami was appointed by the Ministry of Interior as a Guji (chief of those who serves shrine, controls festivals and general affairs) of Gassan-jinja Shrine and a Guji of Haguroyama-jinja Shrine and Yudonosan-jinja Shrine.

sen.j: 学習院や女子師範学校の教授をも兼務している。
sen.e: He concurrently worked as a professor at Gakushuin University and Women's Normal School.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処「学習院」だけでは大学かどうかわかりませんが、「教授」とあるので大学と解釈しました。
sen.e: He concurrently worked as a professor at Gakushuin University and Women's Normal School.
He concurrently worked as a professor at Gakushuin University and Women's Normal School.

sen.j: 國學院大學の創立委員の一人として尽力した。
sen.e: He endeavored as one of the founding members of Kokugakuin University.
He endeavored as one of the founding members of Kokugakuin University.
He endeavored as one of the founding members of Kokugakuin University.

sen.j: 明治16年（1883年)1月2日父高世没する。
sen.e: On January 2, 1883, his father Takayo died.
On January 2, 1883, his father Takayo died.
On January 2, 1883, his father Takayo died.

sen.j: 大分県気付きから東京大学文学部御用掛取扱（准判任官）に任ぜられる。
sen.e: He was transferred from being in charge of Oita Prefecture to being in charge of The University of Tokyo Faculty of Letters (Jun hanninkan (vice junior official)).
He was transferred from being in charge of Oita Prefecture to being in charge of The University of Tokyo Faculty of Letters (Jun hanninkan [vice junior official]).
sen.cmt: 「気付き」は「杵築」の誤りではないかと思われます。括弧内括弧を[]に訂正しました。
sen.e: He was appointed to the post of "Goyo-gakari" (general affairs official) in charge of the affairs of the University of Tokyo Faculty of Letters (as the Jun hanninkan [vice junior official]) after serving as the "Goyo-gakari" in charge of the affairs of Kitsuki, Oita Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 「気付き」は地名「杵築」の誤りのようなので、「大分県杵築御用掛の後、東京大学文学部御用掛に任じられた」と解釈しました。

sen.j: 明治19年（1886年）三月から東京大学教授に任ぜられる。
sen.e: In March 1886, he was appointed as a professor at the University of Tokyo.
In March 1886, he was appointed as a professor at the University of Tokyo.
In March 1886, he was appointed as a professor at the University of Tokyo.

sen.j: さらに、東京師範学校や文部省参事官を兼任する。
sen.e: He concurrently worked in Tokyo normal school and served as Counselor for the Ministry of Education.
He concurrently worked in Tokyo normal school and served as Counselor for the Ministry of Education.
He concurrently worked in Tokyo normal school and served as Counselor for the Ministry of Education.

sen.j: 明治20年（1887年）の1月7日、宮中御講書始めの講師を命じられる。
sen.e: On January 7, 1887, he was appointed as a teacher of gokoshohajime (a ceremony in which a scholar gives lecture to members of the imperial families in the beginning of a new year) at the Imperial court.

On January 7, 1887, he was appointed as a teacher of gokoshohajime (a ceremony in which a scholar gives lecture to members of the imperial families in the beginning of a new year) at the Imperial Court.

On January 7, 1887, he was appointed as a teacher of gokoshohajime (a ceremony in which a scholar gives lecture to members of the imperial families in the beginning of a new year) at the Imperial Court.

sen.j: 夏、避暑先の神奈川県横浜市金沢区富岡で、宮内大臣土方久元や御歌所長高崎正風、警視総監三島通庸などの高官に会った。
sen.e: In the summer, he met high officers such as the Imperial Household Minister Hisamoto HIJIKATA, the chief of Outadokoro (Imperial Poetry Bureau) Masakaze TAKASAKI and the Tokyo Metropolitan Police commissioner Michitsune MISHIMA at the summer resort in Tomioka, Kanazawa Ward, Yokohama City, Kanagawa Prefecture.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In the summer, he met high officers such as the Imperial Household Minister Hisamoto HIJIKATA, the chief of Outadokoro (Imperial Poetry Bureau) Masakaze TAKASAKI and the Tokyo Metropolitan Police commissioner Michitsune MISHIMA at the summer resort in Tomioka, Kanazawa Ward, Yokohama City, Kanagawa Prefecture.

In the summer, he met high officers such as the Imperial Household Minister Hisamoto HIJIKATA, the chief of Outadokoro (Imperial Poetry Bureau) Masakaze TAKASAKI and the Tokyo Metropolitan Police commissioner Michitsune MISHIMA at the summer resort in Tomioka, Kanazawa Ward, Yokohama City, Kanagawa Prefecture.

sen.j: ある高官（松方正義ともいわれる）によって外交官に推されそうになったが謝絶した。
sen.e: One high official (it is said to have been Masayoshi MATSUKATA) almost recommended him as a diplomat, but he declined the offer.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: One high official (it is said to have been Masayoshi MATSUKATA) almost recommended him as a diplomat, but he declined the offer.
One high official (it is said to have been Masayoshi MATSUKATA) almost recommended him as a diplomat, but he declined the offer.

sen.j: その代わりに国語辞典「日本大辞林」編纂事業への資金援助を約束される。
sen.e: Instead, he was promised to be provided with the fund for compiling a Japanese dictionary 'Nihondajjirin.'
Instead, he was promised to be provided with the fund for compiling a Japanese dictionary 'Nihondajjirin.'
sen.cmt: 不要なスペースを削除しました。
sen.e: Instead, he was promised to be provided with the fund for compiling a Japanese dictionary 'Nihondajjirin.'

sen.j: 当時、小学校教師や警察官の月給が6～7円だった時代において、原稿料1枚10円という超巨額の援助だった。
sen.e: At that time when monthly pay for elementary school teacher or police officer was 6 yen to 7 yen, the manuscript fee per sheet was 10 yen, which was a huge amount of financial support.
At that time when monthly pay for elementary school teacher or police officer was 6 yen to 7 yen, the manuscript fee per sheet was 10 yen, which was a huge amount of financial support.
At that time when monthly pay for elementary school teacher or police officer was 6 yen to 7 yen, the manuscript fee per sheet was 10 yen, which was a huge amount of financial support.

sen.j: このほか、門人下田歌子に乞われて、学習院女子高等科の副読本を執筆したこともある。
sen.e: Other than that, he once wrote a supplementary reading material for Gakushuin Girls' Senior High School at the request of a disciple Utako SHIMODA.
Other than that, he once wrote a supplementary reading material for Gakushuin Girls' Senior High School at the request of a disciple Utako SHIMODA.
Other than that, he once wrote a supplementary reading material for Gakushuin Girls' Senior High School at the request of a disciple Utako SHIMODA.

sen.j: 明治23年（1890年）には学習院大学部（旧制）の教授も兼任する。
sen.e: In 1890, he concurrently served as a professor at Gakushuin University (the old system).
In 1890, he concurrently served as a professor at Gakushuin University (the old system).
In 1890, he concurrently served as a professor at Gakushuin University (the old system).

sen.j: 明治28年(1895年)49歳の高見は勲六等瑞宝章を賜る。
sen.e: In 1895 at the age of 49, Takami received the Order of the Sacred Treasure, Silver Rays.
In 1895 at the age of 49, Takami received the Order of the Sacred Treasure, Silver Rays.
In 1895 at the age of 49, Takami received the Order of the Sacred Treasure, Silver Rays.

sen.j: 明治32年（1899年）3月、博士 (文学)となる。
sen.e: In March 1899, he became a doctor (literature).
In March 1899, he became a doctor (literature).
In March 1899, he became a doctor (literature).

sen.j: 同年4月、東京帝国大学文科大学の井上哲次郎の勧告で大学を退官。
sen.e: In April the same year, he retired from the university following the advice by Tetsujiro INOUE of the Tokyo Teikoku Daigaku Bunka Daigaku (Tokyo Imperial University, Faculty of Letters University).
In April the same year, he retired from the university following the advice by Tetsujiro INOUE of the Tokyo Teikoku Daigaku Bunka Daigaku (Tokyo Imperial University, Faculty of Letters University).
In April the same year, he retired from the university following the advice by Tetsujiro INOUE of the Tokyo Teikoku Daigaku Bunka Daigaku (Tokyo Imperial University, Faculty of Letters University).

sen.j: 背景には、門人上田万年との文学論争をきっかけとする、上田とその弟子たちによる追い出し工作があった。
sen.e: Behind this was a maneuver by a disciple Kazutoshi UEDA and his disciples which was triggered by a dispute over literature between the two.
Behind this was a maneuver by a disciple Kazutoshi UEDA and his disciples which was triggered by a dispute over literature between the two.
Behind this was a maneuver by a disciple Kazutoshi UEDA and his disciples which was triggered by a dispute over literature between the two.

sen.j: 高見はこのことを深く恨み、息子高量に向かって「上田の家は小石川伝通院にあるが、決してその前を通ってはならぬ」と命じていた。
sen.e: Takami held a grudge on Ueda about this and told his son Takakazu never to pass in front of Ueda's house located in Koishikawa denzuin.
Takami held a grudge on Ueda about this and told his son Takakazu never to pass in front of Ueda's house located in Koishikawa Denzu-in.
Takami held a grudge on Ueda about this and told his son Takakazu never to pass in front of Ueda's house located in Koishikawa Denzu-in.

sen.j: 辞職直後は、乱れた心を鎮めるため、自宅で習字ばかりしていたとも伝えられている。
sen.e: After the retirement, it is said that Takami practiced calligraphy for most of his time in order to calm him down.
After the retirement, it is said that Takami practiced calligraphy for most of his time in order to calm him down.
After the retirement, it is said that Takami practiced calligraphy for most of his time in order to calm him down.

sen.j: 以後は私財を注ぎ込んで在野の学者として研究に没頭した。
sen.e: Afterward, he used his personal asset and devoted himself to research as a scholar out of power.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Afterward, he used his personal asset and devoted himself to research as a scholar out of power.
Afterward, he used his personal asset and devoted himself to research as a scholar out of power.

sen.j: 貧窮の中で全国を行脚して約5万冊の書物を集め、さらにその総てを読破した。
sen.e: He pilgrimed across the country in poverty, collected about 50,000 books and read all of them.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He pilgrimized across the country in poverty, collected about 50,000 books and read all of them.
sen.cmt: pilgrimized スペル訂正しました。
sen.e: He pilgrimized across the country in poverty, collected about 50,000 books and read all of them.

sen.j: 「広文庫」全20巻の内の第1巻を大正5年（1916年）に広文庫刊行会より刊行、大正7年（1918年）には全巻の刊行を終る。
sen.e: He published the first volume of 'Kobunko' (20-volume set of books) in 1916 from the publishing association of Kobunko, and published the rest of them by 1918.
He published the first volume of 'Kobunko' (20-volume set of books) in 1916 from the publishing association of Kobunko, and published the rest of them by 1918.
He published the first volume of 'Kobunko' (20-volume set of books) in 1916 from the publishing association of Kobunko, and published the rest of them by 1918.

sen.j: 1916年～1917年に全3巻の「群書索引」を刊行してベストセラーとなった。
sen.e: He published a 3-volume set of books of 'Gunshosakuin,' which became a bestseller.
He published a 3-volume set of books of 'Gunshosakuin,' which became a bestseller.
He published a 3-volume set of books of 'Gunshosakuin,' which became a bestseller.

sen.j: 昭和2年（1927年）2月、81歳の折には「皇學叢書」全12巻を刊行した。
sen.e: In February 1927 at the age of 81, he published a 12-volume set of books 'Kogakusosho.'
In February 1927 at the age of 81, he published a 12-volume set of books 'Kogakusosho.'
In February 1927 at the age of 81, he published a 12-volume set of books 'Kogakusosho.'

sen.j: 商業ベースの出版ではなかったが為、膨大な借財を負った。
sen.e: Since the books were not published to make a profit, he ran into a huge amount of debt.
Since the books were not published to make a profit, he ran into a huge amount of debt.
Since the books were not published to make a profit, he ran into a huge amount of debt.

sen.j: 昭和3年（1928年）6月23日、大分県速見郡杵築市寺町の自宅にて逝去した。
sen.e: On June 23, 1928, he died at home in Teramachi, Kitsuki City, Hayami County, Oita Prefecture.
On June 23, 1928, he died at home in Tera-machi, Kitsuki City, Hayami County, Oita Prefecture.
sen.cmt: ハイフン補足しました。
sen.e: On June 23, 1928, he died at home in Tera-machi, Kitsuki City, Hayami County, Oita Prefecture.

sen.j: 享年82。
sen.e: Died at the age of 82.
Died at the age of 82.
Died at the age of 82.

sen.j: 長男物集高量は国文学者。
sen.e: His first son Takakazu MOZUME was an expert on Japanese literature.
His first son Takakazu MOZUME was an expert on Japanese literature.
His first son Takakazu MOZUME was an expert on Japanese literature.

sen.j: 娘の大倉燁子（てるこ）と物集和子は共に小説家。
sen.e: His daughters Teruko OKURA and Kazuko MOZUME were novelists.
His daughters Teruko OKURA and Kazuko MOZUME were novelists.
His daughters Teruko OKURA and Kazuko MOZUME were novelists.
